ACT
23
Adoption in case of parental adoption
Through parental adoption, the adopter and the adoptee mutually acquire the right of legal inheritance of blood relatives in a straight line, so that the adoptee and the adoptee's descendants have inheritance rights towards the adopter as if they were the adopter's children, i.e. further descendants of the adopter , and the adopter and his ancestors have towards the adoptee and his descendants have the same inheritance rights as if the adoptive parent were the adopted child's parent, and the adoptive parent's ancestors were the adopted child's ancestors.
An adopted child from parental adoption and his descendants do not inherit by law the adopter's collateral relatives, his spouse, nor his adopted children based on parental adoption, nor the descendants of such adopted children.
Parental adoption terminates the mutual inheritance rights of the adopted child and his blood relatives. Exceptionally, parental adoption does not affect the inheritance rights of the adopted child and his descendants towards the adopted child's parent who is married to the adoptive parent, and the blood relatives of that parent.
